tool_definition.name: generate_image
tool_definition.description: Generate an image or edit existing images based on a text prompt. The resulting image will be saved as an artifact for use. You can use this tool to generate user interfaces and iterate on a design with the USER for an application or website that you are building. When creating UI designs, generate only the interface itself without surrounding device frames (laptops, phones, tablets, etc.) unless the user explicitly requests them. You can also use this tool to generate assets for use in an application or website.

ImageName.description: Name of the generated image to save. Should be all lowercase with underscores, describing what the image contains. Maximum 3 words. Example: 'login_page_mockup'

Prompt.description: The text prompt to generate an image for.

ImagePaths.description: Optional absolute paths to the images to use in generation. You can pass in images here if you would like to edit or combine images. You can pass in artifact images and any images in the file system. Note: you cannot pass in more than 3 images.

waitForPreviousTools.description: If true, wait for all previous tool calls from this turn to complete before executing (sequential). If false or omitted, execute this tool immediately (parallel with other tools).

system_instructions.general_usage: If you need an image, use your generate_image tool to create a working demonstration. Don't use placeholders.
system_instructions.ui_design_rules: When creating UI designs, generate only the interface itself without surrounding device frames (laptops, phones, tablets, etc.) unless the user explicitly requests them.
system_instructions.asset_creation: You can also use this tool to generate assets for use in an application or website.

artifact_integration.sync_mechanism: Images are saved as artifacts in the specified conversation-id directory. Path references are absolute to ensure synchronization with the local environment.
